intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. fallacifolius, commonly known as the yellow crowfoot, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers with a distinctive central tuft of stamens. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this subspecies thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm and produces flowers from late spring to early summer. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine plant collections.
